creator: Jonas.Olsson@cambiosys.com
text:
Attached are new base-classes I coded to extend the existing (e.g. 
AbstractGenerativeController, LogicController).
The code is uncommented (so much to do, so little time), but the common trait 
is that the constructor takes the arguments required for proper jMeter 
integration (providing a more automatic check for "validity").
Also note that ConfigElementBase and ConfigElementBaseGui provides a dynamic 
GUI for parameter setting (for those of us who don't need a flashy layout, just 
the fields to enter values).

It appears you made base classes for yourself to make extending JMeter easier.  
I have two comments:

1. In the new src_1 sources, extending JMeter should be quite a bit easier to 
do.  Please take a look (it's nearly fully functional - remote testing is the 
only thing I haven't tested much yet).

2. I'd prefer it if you helped me make improvements to the existing base 
classes rather than adding another layer.  They are there to make it as easy as 
possible, so if you have ideas on how to make it easier, I'd like to put those 
changes directly into the existing classes.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
Jonas.Olsson@cambiosys.com
text:
1. I downloaded the latest version and worked from that, I'm not able to keep 
up-to-date with development.
2. My intention was to produce a thin "add-on" for internal use (i.e. install 
jMeter, add this JAR and go for it). On a "hunch" I also submitted it here for 
evaluation. Of course these additions (if found valuable) should become part of 
the JMeter classes, but they're not as I deliberately did not change the 
original installation.

On the whole I have not enough time (on or off work) to play an active role in 
jMeter, I just wanted to submit what I'd done for you to evaluate. The jMeter 
user list suggested an RFE ...
My base-classes addresses some points I found lacking:

- No uniform naming of base-classes (Logic vs Generative)
- No easy way of making a simple ConfigElement without doing your own GUI
- Explicit setting required for compulsory items (e.g. class label)
  (I put them in constructors instead)

Taking one of Jonas' suggestions, I'm converting this request to be a request
for a config GUI class that shows a simplistic UI for dealing with the data of a
test element.  Anyone creating a new test element could use it to test their
code in JMeter's GUI framework. 

The rest of Jonas' suggestions are essentially done in current code.
